metadata.title: CVE-2019-11750 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A type confusion vulnerability exists in Spidermonkey, which results in anon-exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 69 and FirefoxESR < 68.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11750` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
